scrapingNotes: Fresh scraping from Meta Ad Library - 2026-02-24. Searched by advertiser page, not keyword.

swipes.primaryText: Comment "YOUTUBE"
swipes.hookFramework: Engagement Bait â†’ Profile Redirect: Uses a simple keyword comment CTA ('Comment YOUTUBE') to drive engagement, then links to Instagram profile as the conversion point. Carousel of Instagram profile links creates multiple click opportunities.
swipes.copyStructure: Single-line CTA â†’ Profile link carousel
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches who follow Will Nelson's content and want to see his YouTube strategy breakdowns
swipes.whyItWorks: Extremely low-friction entry point â€” asking for a one-word comment feels effortless and triggers algorithmic boost from engagement. The carousel of Instagram links gives multiple chances to click through. Running since Dec 2025 suggests strong performance as an evergreen top-of-funnel engagement driver.
swipeElements: carousel format for multiple click targets

swipes.headline: Online Fitness Coaches Who Want To Scale With Predictabllitiy
swipes.hookFramework: Niche Callout â†’ Benefit Promise: Calls out exact target audience in the headline ('Online Fitness Coaches') then promises the core desire ('Scale With Predictability'). Image-based ad with multiple versions being tested.
swipes.copyStructure: Headline callout â†’ Benefit promise â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches doing $5-20K/mo who want predictable client acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: The headline does all the heavy lifting â€” it's a precise niche callout that self-selects the right audience while simultaneously promising the #1 desire (predictable scaling). Multiple versions suggest active split-testing. The typo in 'Predictabllitiy' is either intentional pattern interrupt or untested â€” worth noting.
swipes.notes: Has multiple versions â€” active split testing

swipes.primaryText: If you've given up on Facebook ads for your fitness businessâ€¦ I get it. You probably blew a few thousand bucks. Got a flood of leads who couldn't afford a $20 Costco membership... let alone your high-ticket program. And you swore ads off forever. I get itâ€¦ But here's the thingâ€¦ If you haven't tried ads in the last YEAR... You're basing your opinion on an algorithm that doesn't even exist anymore. Facebook rolled out two MASSIVE updates just a few months ago called Andromeda and Lattice. I'm not gonna bore you with the techy details... But the short version is this: It's never been easier to attract clients who can actually afford to work with you. Not tire-kickers. Not "let me think about it" people. But actual real buyers. And that's where my company comes in. Because I've helped over 700 fitness coaches build predictable client acquisition systems using Facebook ads. And the last few months I have just never seen results like this before. We're seeing results that would've been straight-up impossible two years ago. Like Nick... Who tried ads for MONTHS with zero success, but used our system to book 15 calls that turned into $20k in sales. Or Amir... Who burned through $5K in failed ads before working with us, but within 4 days of working with us he made $7k in sales using our updated approach. Or Ryan and Danielle... Who wasted THOUSANDS on agencies that got them nothing but broke leads. But with MY ad system, they only had to spend $300 in ads to generate $7k in sales. Each of these people had FAILED with Facebook ads before. But now? They've got a predictable, reliable lead gen system that actually works. The reason they got results like this is because we built our Instagram Authority Funnel specifically around these new algorithm updates. So here's what I'm offering... Give me just 10 days to install our Instagram Authority Funnel at zero risk to you. Now... let me be clear. This is ONLY for online fitness coaches who: 1. Have great client results AND 2. Have a budget to spend on ads. If that's you... Then do this: Click the link below. Fill out a 60-second application. Book a call with me where I'll demo the Instagram Authority Funnel so you can see how it works from A to Z. And you can decide for yourself if it makes sense. Sound fair? Cool. Talk soon. -Will
swipes.hookFramework: Empathy Open â†’ Reframe â†’ Social Proof Stack â†’ Risk Reversal â†’ Application CTA: Opens by validating the reader's past failure ('I get it, you probably blew a few thousand bucks'), then reframes the problem as outdated information ('algorithm doesn't exist anymore'), introduces proprietary system with 3 specific case studies (Nick: $20K, Amir: $7K in 4 days, Ryan & Danielle: $300â†’$7K), offers risk reversal ('zero risk'), and closes with qualification gate.
swipes.copyStructure: Pain validation â†’ Reframe (outdated algorithm) â†’ Authority claim (700+ coaches) â†’ 3 case studies with specific numbers â†’ Proprietary system name (Instagram Authority Funnel) â†’ Risk reversal (10 days, zero risk) â†’ Qualification filter (2 criteria) â†’ Application CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches who have tried and failed with Facebook ads, making $5-20K/mo with proven client results, ready to invest in paid acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: This is Will's primary long-form ad running across 5+ variations. The genius is the empathy-to-reframe structure â€” he doesn't argue that ads work, he validates the failure and then explains WHY it failed (old algorithm). The 3 case studies follow a 'failed before â†’ succeeded with us' pattern that directly addresses the reader's exact objection. The qualification criteria at the end create exclusivity and filter for serious buyers. The conversational tone ('Cool. Talk soon. -Will') builds personal connection at scale.
swipeElements: empathy hook that validates past failure
3 named case studies with specific dollar amounts
before/after pattern for each case study
swipes.notes: This is Will's MAIN ad â€” running across 5+ creative variations with same copy. His highest-volume piece.

swipes.primaryText: You don't need more followers. You need more leads. If you've been posting content hoping it'll magically bring in clientsâ€¦ But all it's bringing is burnout â€” It's time to try something that actually scales. What you need is a system that puts your offer in front of ready-to-buy clients â€” every single day. We help online fitness coaches install simple ad systems that turn cold traffic into booked calls without being "famous" on Instagram. â†’ No big audience â†’ No viral content â†’ No begging for DMs Just leads. Every day. ðŸ‘‰ Click Learn More to see how it works.
swipes.hookFramework: Contrarian Statement â†’ Pain Point â†’ System Promise â†’ Anti-list: Opens with a contrarian reframe ('You don't need more followers. You need more leads.') that challenges the common content-creation hustle. Paints the pain of content burnout, then positions a systematic alternative. The anti-list (No big audience, No viral content, No begging for DMs) removes objections by negating everything the reader hates doing.
swipes.copyStructure: Contrarian hook â†’ Pain agitation (content burnout) â†’ System positioning â†’ Anti-list (what you DON'T need) â†’ Simple CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches stuck in the content treadmill, posting daily but not converting, burnt out on organic social media marketing
swipes.whyItWorks: This shorter-form ad is the perfect complement to wn-003. While the long-form ad speaks to ad-skeptics, this one targets content-exhausted coaches. The contrarian opener ('You don't need more followers') challenges the dominant Instagram growth narrative. The anti-list is brilliant because it lists everything the reader is already tired of doing â€” making the alternative feel like relief rather than another tactic. Running across 13+ variations with video suggests this is a high-performer.
swipes.notes: Running across 13+ creative variations â€” clearly a top performer. Shorter than wn-003 but complementary targeting.

swipes.headline: 700+ Fitness Coaches Can't Be Wrong
swipes.primaryText: If you've given up on Facebook ads for your fitness businessâ€¦ I get it...
swipes.hookFramework: Social Proof Headline â†’ Long-form Pain-to-Solution: Headline uses volume social proof ('700+ Fitness Coaches Can't Be Wrong') as an authority anchor, paired with the same long-form copy as wn-003 but with a video creative. The headline does the trust-building before the reader even starts the copy.
swipes.copyStructure: Social proof headline â†’ Same long-form body as wn-003 â†’ Video creative â†’ Apply now CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Same as wn-003 â€” ad-skeptic fitness coaches ready for paid acquisition
swipes.whyItWorks: Same copy as wn-003 but with an authority-anchoring headline that the other versions don't have. The '700+' number is specific enough to be credible but round enough to feel impressive. Testing headline + video combination against text-only versions. 0:39 video length is ideal for attention spans.
swipes.notes: Same body copy as wn-003 but with social proof headline and video. Testing creative format.

swipes.headline: Million Dollar Client Getting System For Coaches
swipes.primaryText: You don't need more followers. You need more leads...
swipes.hookFramework: Aspirational Headline â†’ Contrarian Body: Pairs an aspirational revenue headline ('Million Dollar Client Getting System') with the shorter contrarian body copy from wn-004. The headline sells the dream outcome while the body validates the reader's frustration.
swipes.copyStructure: Aspirational headline â†’ Contrarian body copy â†’ Image creative â†’ Learn more CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Ambitious online fitness coaches who want a million-dollar system, frustrated with content marketing
swipes.whyItWorks: This variant combines the aspirational headline with the shorter, punchier body copy. The headline promises big ('Million Dollar') while the body stays grounded and relatable. Image format with description line 'The Fit Pro CEO helping clients grow their business' adds brand reinforcement. Testing image vs video with same copy.
swipes.notes: Image format variant with aspirational headline + short body copy

swipes.headline: Online Fitness Coach Who Want To Scale...
swipes.hookFramework: Niche Callout Headline â†’ Image Creative â†’ Direct CTA: Stripped-down version with just a niche-targeting headline and image. Minimal copy lets the creative do the talking. Testing whether the image/video alone can convert without long-form text.
swipes.copyStructure: Headline only â†’ Image/video â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Online fitness coaches looking to scale
swipes.whyItWorks: This minimal-copy approach tests whether Will's brand recognition and creative alone can drive clicks without the long-form persuasion. Multiple versions suggest he's testing different creatives against this same minimal headline framework.
swipes.notes: Minimal copy variant â€” testing creative-led conversion

swipes.headline: Fitness Business Mentors
swipes.hookFramework: Video-First Brand Introduction: Relies entirely on 1:14 video creative with minimal text. Headline is just the brand name, description is generic (Check it out now!). The video does all persuasion work â€” this is a brand awareness play that trusts the video content to qualify and convert.
swipes.copyStructure: Brand name headline â†’ Video (1:14) â†’ Generic CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Experienced fitness business owners looking to scale beyond Instagram, likely making $10K+/mo
swipes.whyItWorks: Longest-running active ad (since Jan 13) â€” the video carries the entire conversion burden without any supporting copy. This suggests the video content itself is highly compelling. The zero-copy approach is a bold test against their other text-heavy variations.
swipes.notes: One of the oldest active ads â€” running since Jan 13. Video-only persuasion.

swipes.headline: Where Elite Clients Decide
swipes.hookFramework: Aspirational Identity Headline: "Where Elite Clients Decide" positions their platform as a premium decision space, not a marketplace. The word "elite" pre-qualifies the audience and "decide" implies the clients are already high-intent â€” they just need to choose you.
swipes.copyStructure: Aspirational headline â†’ Video (1:14) â†’ Learn more CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Fitness coaches who want premium/elite clientele, frustrated with low-ticket or price-shopping leads
swipes.whyItWorks: The headline reframes the entire client acquisition game â€” instead of "get more clients" it is "be where the right clients already are." This appeals to the identity of coaches who see themselves as premium providers. Same video as fbm-001 but different headline framing â€” classic A/B test.
swipes.notes: Same video as fbm-001, testing aspirational headline vs generic

swipes.headline: Fitness Business Mentors
swipes.hookFramework: Long-Form Video Education: 2:48 video â€” their longest creative. Zero body copy, just brand name headline. The extended runtime suggests a mini-training or detailed case study format designed to build trust and pre-sell before the click.
swipes.copyStructure: Brand name headline â†’ Long video (2:48) â†’ Generic CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Fitness business owners willing to invest time watching content â€” signals higher buyer intent
swipes.whyItWorks: At 2:48, this is their longest video ad. People who watch long-form ads are significantly more qualified â€” they have demonstrated interest through attention. This serves as a pre-qualification tool, filtering for serious prospects before they ever click.
swipes.notes: Longest video creative â€” likely detailed training or case study

swipes.headline: Tired of Low-Paying Clients?
swipes.hookFramework: Pain-Point Question Headline: Asks the exact question their target audience is already asking themselves. "Tired of Low-Paying Clients?" is a direct pain probe that self-selects coaches who are stuck in the low-ticket grind. Video (1:51) likely presents the solution.
swipes.copyStructure: Pain question headline â†’ Video (1:51) â†’ Learn more CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Fitness coaches making money but stuck at low price points, charging $100-300/mo for online coaching
swipes.whyItWorks: This is their most direct pain-point headline. Running since Jan 13 alongside the aspirational headlines â€” testing pain-driven vs aspiration-driven messaging on the same audience. The question format triggers self-identification ("yes, that is me").
swipes.notes: Running since Jan 13 â€” testing pain headline vs aspirational/brand headlines

swipes.headline: When growth finally matches your competence
swipes.primaryText: Logic is no longer the barrier. It's time to align your online presence with authority and standards. You're ready for growth, but first, you need to be seen accurately - not louder or flashier, just clearly. This isn't about chasing more; it's about alignment: visibility that matches your expertise, demand that meets your high standards, and a business that reflects the life you're building now. Ready to break through? The next step isn't a sales pitch, but a conversation about elevating your professional presence. Let's explore how this works together!
swipes.hookFramework: Identity Alignment â†’ Anti-Hype Positioning: The headline ("When growth finally matches your competence") validates the reader's belief that they deserve more. The body copy leans heavily into anti-hype language ("not louder or flashier, just clearly") which resonates with experienced coaches who are turned off by bro-marketing. Positions the consultation as "a conversation" not a "sales pitch."
swipes.copyStructure: Identity validation headline â†’ Alignment messaging â†’ Anti-hype positioning â†’ Soft CTA (conversation not pitch)
swipes.targetAudience: Experienced fitness coaches who feel their business doesn't reflect their expertise level, anti-hype, values-driven professionals
swipes.whyItWorks: This is the most sophisticated copy in their arsenal. It speaks to the specific frustration of competent coaches whose revenue doesn't match their skill. The anti-hype tone ("not louder or flashier") directly positions against competitors like Will Nelson who use high-energy sales language. The soft CTA ("conversation" not "sales pitch") removes pressure and appeals to discerning buyers.
swipes.notes: Most sophisticated copy â€” anti-hype positioning that could resonate with LFG audience

swipes.headline: Stop Chasing Instagram Likes for Big Deals
swipes.hookFramework: Platform Contrarian â†’ Authority Redirect: "Stop Chasing Instagram Likes for Big Deals" challenges the dominant Instagram-growth narrative and implies there's a better channel. Paired with "Where Elite Clients Decide" as the description â€” suggesting LinkedIn or a professional platform is the real play.
swipes.copyStructure: Contrarian headline â†’ Authority description â†’ Video (1:52) â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Fitness coaches frustrated with Instagram's diminishing returns, open to alternative platforms like LinkedIn
swipes.whyItWorks: Directly attacks the Instagram hamster wheel that most fitness coaches are stuck on. The contrast between "Instagram Likes" (vanity metrics) and "Big Deals" (real revenue) creates tension. This is a platform-shift ad that positions FBM as the guide for coaches ready to graduate beyond social media.
swipeElements: vanity metrics vs real revenue contrast
swipes.notes: Anti-Instagram messaging â€” interesting contrast with Will Nelson who pushes Instagram Authority Funnel

swipes.headline: The Secret to LinkedIn Success
swipes.hookFramework: Curiosity Gap + Platform Specificity: "The Secret to LinkedIn Success" uses a classic curiosity gap (what's the secret?) combined with platform specificity (LinkedIn â€” unexpected for fitness coaches). The novelty of LinkedIn for fitness creates its own pattern interrupt.
swipes.copyStructure: Curiosity headline â†’ Video (1:16) â†’ Learn more CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Fitness business owners curious about LinkedIn as a client acquisition channel
swipes.whyItWorks: LinkedIn is an unexpected channel for fitness coaches, which creates natural curiosity. The "Secret" framing implies insider knowledge. Running since Jan 13 alongside their other ads â€” this tests whether the LinkedIn angle itself is compelling enough to drive clicks.
swipes.notes: LinkedIn angle is their unique differentiator from competitors

swipes.headline: Why referral-based growth quietly caps experienced fitness businesses
swipes.hookFramework: Problem Education Headline: Teaches the audience about a problem they didn't know they had. "Referral-based growth quietly caps" â€” most coaches think referrals are good, but this reframes them as a ceiling. "Quietly" is key â€” it implies the cap is invisible until it's too late.
swipes.copyStructure: Problem education headline â†’ "Outgrown Instagram?" description â†’ Video (1:32) â†’ Learn More CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Established fitness coaches who rely on referrals and word-of-mouth, making $10-30K/mo but plateaued
swipes.whyItWorks: Brilliant reframe â€” referrals are universally seen as positive, but this ad reveals them as a hidden growth limiter. The word "quietly" creates unease because it implies the problem is already happening without their knowledge. Combined with "Outgrown Instagram?" description, it paints a picture of a coach who has hit multiple invisible ceilings.
swipes.notes: Best hook in their library â€” reframes something positive (referrals) as a hidden limiter

swipes.headline: A LinkedIn authority system built for experienced fitness founders
swipes.primaryText: Ready to stand out without screaming for attention? You're not looking for a quick fix, but a system that respects your hard work. Will it protect my reputation? Attract the right people? Feel calm instead of draining? This approach filters before attracting, clarifies before amplifying. It's not about being loud, but unmistakable. See how this works.
swipes.hookFramework: Self-Answering Objection Handler: The copy anticipates and voices the exact objections the reader has ("Will it protect my reputation? Attract the right people? Feel calm instead of draining?") then answers them. This creates an internal dialogue that feels like the ad is reading their mind. The "filters before attracting, clarifies before amplifying" line positions their approach as the opposite of volume-based marketing.
swipes.copyStructure: Question hook â†’ Objection voicing â†’ Principle statements â†’ Soft CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Reputation-conscious fitness founders who fear that marketing = being loud/salesy
swipes.whyItWorks: This ad speaks directly to the coach who wants to grow but is afraid of looking desperate or salesy. By voicing their exact fears as questions, it creates deep resonance. The principle-based answer ("filters before attracting") sounds sophisticated and different from typical ad copy. The "unmistakable" vs "loud" dichotomy is memorable and shareworthy.
swipes.notes: Excellent objection-handling copy â€” could inspire LFG ad approach

swipes.headline: The quiet ceiling experienced coaches feel before they ever feel stuck
swipes.primaryText: You're a successful business owner, but there's an uncomfortable truth: Your growth still depends on being remembered. Inconsistent months make you hesitate. Referrals feel like a ceiling, not a strategy. Why do others with less experience seem louder and more visible? You deliver great work, but it doesn't speak loudly or consistently. Feel capped by your invisibility? Tap Learn More to understand what's really going on
swipes.hookFramework: Invisible Pain Naming â†’ Jealousy Trigger â†’ Identity Challenge: Names a pain the audience feels but can't articulate ("quiet ceiling"). Then hits the jealousy trigger ("Why do others with less experience seem louder?") which is deeply relatable for skilled coaches watching flashier competitors succeed. "Capped by your invisibility" is a devastating phrase that names the exact problem.
swipes.copyStructure: Invisible pain headline â†’ Uncomfortable truth â†’ Jealousy trigger â†’ Identity challenge â†’ CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Skilled but under-visible fitness coaches who watch less experienced competitors outpace them, making $10-30K/mo
swipes.whyItWorks: This is their strongest long-form copy. It names feelings the reader has never put into words â€” the "quiet ceiling," the frustration of watching less skilled people succeed, the gap between competence and visibility. The longest video (3:02) paired with the most emotionally resonant copy suggests this is meant to be their highest-converting piece for warm audiences. Every sentence hits a nerve.
swipes.notes: Strongest emotional copy in their library â€” jealousy trigger is powerful and underused

swipes.headline: Download Free Personalized Scaling Roadmap
swipes.primaryText: **Are you struggling to scale?** To scale, you need one of these three things: 1. Better advertising and sales processes to get more customers 2. Increased customer value to afford more advertising and sales 3. More people to help keep up with demand The good news? We've designed a Scaling Roadmap that teaches how to solve these constraints. And we've personalized it for your business. We're confident it can help you break through to the next level. Just answer a few questions and we'll send it to you for free.
swipes.hookFramework: Problem Framework â†’ Personalized Lead Magnet: Opens with a bold question, then teaches the 3 scaling constraints (advertising/sales, customer value, team capacity). Offers a 'personalized' roadmap as the lead magnet â€” the personalization is the hook that elevates this above generic PDFs. The framework itself becomes the selling tool.
swipes.copyStructure: Bold question â†’ 3-part framework â†’ Solution (personalized roadmap) â†’ Low-friction CTA (answer questions â†’ free)
swipes.targetAudience: Business owners doing $1M-$10M/yr who feel stuck at a revenue ceiling, ready to invest in growth systems
swipes.whyItWorks: This is Hormozi's WORKHORSE ad â€” running since March 2025 across 20+ video variations (0:27 to 1:15). The 3-constraint framework is brilliant because it sounds like a diagnostic tool, not a pitch. 'Personalized for your business' converts the lead magnet from commodity to custom. The 'just answer a few questions' is a trojan horse for a qualifying survey. Longest-running ad = proven performer.
swipes.notes: MAIN AD â€” running 11+ months across 20+ variations. acquisition.com/roadmap funnel.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: We're hosting a private session at Acquisition.com's Las Vegas HQ to show entrepreneurs the exact methods we use to scale businesses. Want to be in the room? Click below to see if you're a fit. Advantage+ creative text generation
swipes.hookFramework: Exclusive Access â†’ Location Authority â†’ Qualification Gate: 'Private session at Las Vegas HQ' combines exclusivity with physical-space authority. 'See if you're a fit' creates a qualification dynamic where the prospect must earn access. Short and punchy â€” lets the video do the heavy lifting.
swipes.copyStructure: Exclusive invite â†’ Location credibility â†’ Qualification question â†’ CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Established business owners ($3M+) who want hands-on scaling help and can travel to Vegas
swipes.whyItWorks: The 'private session at HQ' framing transforms a workshop into an exclusive invitation. 'See if you're a fit' flips the sales dynamic â€” instead of Hormozi selling to them, they're applying to him. Running since Sep 2025 suggests consistent performance for their high-ticket workshop funnel (acquisition.com/workshop-km).
swipes.notes: Workshop funnel â€” higher ticket than roadmap. Running since Sep 2025.

swipes.headline: Download Free Scaling Frameworks
swipes.primaryText: Business Owners â€“ real quick â€“ can I get your email? I want to send you the exact frameworks we've used to scale: Sales, Teams, Communication, Compensation, Worker productivity. These are the same systems we implement across our portfolio companies, and you can get themâ€”for free. But that's just the beginning. These frameworks are only a fraction of what we cover in our Scaling Workshop. Our two-day intensive at our headquarters includes: Day 1: Deep dive into our proven scaling methodology. Day 2: Group sessions with our leadership team to help you apply it. You'll leave with a clear, actionable plan to scale every function of your business. If you're serious about growth this year, spend two days in Vegas surrounded by high-level business owners who are in the trenches like you. Download your free scaling frameworks â†’ Book a call to learn more. P.S. This is only for business owners with customers, revenue, and employeesâ€”so every conversation stays high level.
swipes.hookFramework: Casual Email Ask â†’ Value Stack â†’ Workshop Upsell â†’ Qualification P.S.: Opens with disarmingly casual 'can I get your email?' then stacks 5 specific framework topics. The free frameworks serve as a Trojan horse for the $$ workshop pitch. The P.S. qualification ('only for business owners with customers, revenue, and employees') is the real filter â€” it makes the reader self-select as worthy.
swipes.copyStructure: Casual ask â†’ 5-topic value stack â†’ Free offer â†’ Workshop upsell (2-day agenda) â†’ Social proof environment â†’ Qualification P.S.
swipes.targetAudience: Business owners with established teams and revenue, ready for a $5K+ workshop investment
swipes.whyItWorks: The 'real quick â€“ can I get your email?' opener breaks pattern â€” it's casual and direct in a way that stands out from polished ad copy. The 5 framework topics (Sales, Teams, Communication, Compensation, Productivity) cover every scaling pain point. The P.S. qualification is genius â€” it makes the workshop feel exclusive while filtering out tire-kickers. Multi-image carousel format with multiple CTA buttons.
swipes.notes: Scaling Frameworks â†’ Workshop funnel. Heavy on Leila co-branding.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: Here's a hard truth: investors don't buy businesses that can't survive without the founder. It doesn't matter how much revenue you do. If every decision, every client, and every fire comes back to you, the value of your company is close to zero. That's key man risk. And until you solve it, you don't have an asset. You have a liability. We've built systems inside our portfolio companies to remove founder dependency and create businesses that actually scaleâ€¦ and sell. That's what we teach, hands-on, at our Scaling Workshop in Vegas. If you want to build something that outlives you, click below and let's talk.
swipes.hookFramework: Hard Truth Opener â†’ Investor Lens Reframe â†’ Asset vs Liability â†’ Workshop Solution: Opens with 'hard truth' pattern interrupt, then reframes the reader's business through an investor's eyes. 'Key man risk' introduces sophisticated vocabulary that makes the reader feel they're getting insider knowledge. The asset/liability dichotomy is devastating â€” every founder fears being told their business has no value.
swipes.copyStructure: Hard truth hook â†’ Investor perspective â†’ Key man risk concept â†’ Asset vs liability reframe â†’ Portfolio proof â†’ Workshop CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Founders doing $1M-$10M+ who want to eventually exit/sell, feeling trapped in day-to-day operations
swipes.whyItWorks: This is Hormozi's most emotionally potent ad. The 'investors don't buy businesses that can't survive without the founder' line is a gut punch to every founder who IS their business. 'Key man risk' sounds like something an investor would actually say, adding credibility. The progression from problem to concept to solution is textbook â€” and the 'build something that outlives you' close taps into legacy motivation.
swipes.notes: Most emotionally potent copy â€” key man risk angle. Multiple variations.

swipes.primaryText: This might be the greatest free book offer of all time. Entrepreneurs from all over the world already prepaid for copies so others could get them for free. We've got stacks of books in the warehouse already covered by those donationsâ€¦ all you have to do is claim yours. And to match that, I'm throwing in the first two books in the series for free too. And if that wasn't crazy enough, you're also going to get a free month of Skool. It's everything you need to build your business for $16. If you're an entrepreneur or want to be one, these books will show you: What to sell, How to sell it, How to scale it. They've sold over 5 million copies and earned 32,000+ 5-star reviews. Just cover the $16 shipping and they're yours, along with a month of Skool and a community of entrepreneurs.
swipes.hookFramework: Greatest Offer Claim â†’ Community Generosity Story â†’ Value Stack â†’ Social Proof Avalanche â†’ Micro-Commitment: Opens with superlative ('greatest free book offer of all time'), then tells the story of entrepreneurs pre-paying for others' copies â€” creating a community narrative. Stacks value (3 books + Skool month) against tiny cost ($16 shipping). The 5M copies + 32K reviews is an overwhelming proof stack.
swipes.copyStructure: Superlative claim â†’ Community story â†’ Value stack (3 books + Skool) â†’ Social proof (5M copies, 32K reviews) â†’ Micro-commitment ($16)
swipes.targetAudience: Aspiring and early-stage entrepreneurs who can't afford expensive programs, Skool-curious audience
swipes.whyItWorks: The 'entrepreneurs prepaid for others' story transforms a book offer into a movement â€” you're not just buying, you're joining a community of generous entrepreneurs. The $16 for 3 books + Skool month is an absurdly good offer that creates massive goodwill. The 5M copies and 32K reviews make this feel like a cultural phenomenon, not a sales pitch. This is Hormozi's Skool acquisition funnel.
swipeElements: extreme value-to-cost ratio ($16 for 3 books + Skool)
swipes.notes: Skool/book bundle funnel â€” skool.com/backpack. Cross-promoting Skool platform.

swipes.headline: It's not an event, it's a Scaling Workshop.
swipes.primaryText: If you run a home service business doing over $1M a year like HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, or cleaning, and the whole thing still runs through you, you don't own a business. You own a job with overhead. Every hire depends on you. Every problem finds you. Every client needs your approval. That's why you can't take time off. Why every growth spurt feels worse than standing still. That's called key man risk, and it's the reason most 7-figure businesses stay stuck forever. At my Scaling Workshop in Vegas, I show founders how to break out by building the systems, leadership, and processes that make the business run without them.
swipes.hookFramework: Industry-Specific Pain â†’ Key Man Risk â†’ Workshop Solution: Same key-man-risk framework as ah-004 but targeted specifically at home service businesses ($1M+ HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, cleaning). The industry callout makes it feel like a custom ad for that audience. 'Job with overhead' is a devastating reframe.
swipes.copyStructure: Industry callout â†’ Pain validation (every hire, every problem, every client) â†’ Key man risk education â†’ Workshop CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Home service business owners doing $1M+/yr (HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, cleaning)
swipes.whyItWorks: Same core message as ah-004 but laser-targeted at a specific industry. The 'HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, or cleaning' callout makes this feel personally relevant to anyone in those industries. 'Job with overhead' is one of the most devastating reframes in advertising â€” it takes something the reader is proud of (their business) and reveals it as a trap. Workshop-hs URL suggests industry-specific landing page.
swipeElements: headline reframe: not event, scaling workshop
swipes.notes: Industry-specific variant â€” home services. Same framework, different audience. workshop-hs funnel.

swipes.headline: Download Free Personalized Scaling Roadmap
swipes.primaryText: **Are you struggling to scale?** To scale, you need one of these three things: 1. Better advertising and sales processes to get more customers 2. Increased customer value to afford more advertising and sales 3. More people to help keep up with demand The good news? We've designed a Scaling Roadmap that teaches how to solve these constraints. And we've personalized it for your business. We're confident it can help you break through to the next level. Just answer a few questions and we'll send it to you for free.
swipes.hookFramework: Constraint Diagnosis â†’ Personalized Solution: Opens with bold pain question ("struggling to scale?"), then frames scaling as exactly 3 solvable constraints â€” creating a diagnostic framework that makes the reader feel their problem is understood and categorizable. The "personalized" roadmap promises custom solutions without the cost of consulting.
swipes.copyStructure: Bold pain question â†’ Numbered constraint list (3 items) â†’ Positive reframe ("good news") â†’ Personalized solution offer â†’ Zero-risk CTA ("free")
swipes.targetAudience: Business owners doing $1M-$10M/year who feel stuck at a revenue ceiling, have tried scaling but hit bottlenecks in advertising, customer value, or team capacity
swipes.whyItWorks: This is Hormozi's highest-volume ad â€” running since March 2025 with 10+ video variants (0:27 to 1:15). The 3-constraint framework creates an "aha" moment where the reader self-diagnoses their bottleneck. "Personalized" adds perceived value to a free lead magnet. The numbered list structure is scannable on mobile. Multiple video lengths allow Meta's algorithm to optimize for different attention spans across placements.
swipes.notes: Hormozi's primary top-of-funnel ad. Runs with at least 12 different video creatives simultaneously. All point to acquisition.com/roadmap quiz funnel. This is the ad that feeds their entire pipeline.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: We're hosting a private session at Acquisition.com's Las Vegas HQ to show entrepreneurs the exact methods we use to scale businesses. Want to be in the room? Click below to see if you're a fit.
swipes.hookFramework: Exclusive Insider Access â†’ Qualification Filter: Positions the workshop as a "private session" at their actual HQ â€” leveraging physical location credibility and scarcity. "Want to be in the room?" creates FOMO. "See if you're a fit" reverses the sales dynamic â€” now the prospect must qualify themselves.
swipes.copyStructure: Exclusive invitation â†’ Physical location anchor (Las Vegas HQ) â†’ Value promise (exact methods) â†’ Qualifying CTA ("see if you're a fit")
swipes.targetAudience: Established business owners ($3M-$30M) who want hands-on strategic help and are willing to travel to Vegas for high-level networking and implementation
swipes.whyItWorks: Short, punchy copy (3 sentences) with maximum status signaling. "Private session" + "Las Vegas HQ" + "exact methods" stack exclusivity, credibility, and specificity. The qualifying language ("see if you're a fit") pre-frames the sales call as an application, not a pitch. Advantage+ creative text generation tag suggests Meta is auto-generating variants.
swipeElements: self-qualification CTA ("see if you're a fit")
swipes.notes: Mid-funnel workshop ad. Much shorter copy than the roadmap ads â€” designed for warmer audiences who already know Hormozi.

swipes.headline: Everything You Need to Build Your Business for $16
swipes.primaryText: This might be the greatest free book offer of all time. Entrepreneurs from all over the world already prepaid for copies so others could get them for free. We've got stacks of books in the warehouse already covered by those donationsâ€¦ all you have to do is claim yours. And to match that, I'm throwing in the first two books in the series for free too. And if that wasn't crazy enough, you're also going to get a free month of Skool. It's everything you need to build your business for $16. If you're an entrepreneur or want to be one, these books will show you: - What to sell - How to sell it - How to scale it They've sold over 5 million copies and earned 32,000+ 5-star reviews. Just cover the $16 shipping and they're yours, along with a month of Skool and a community of entrepreneurs. Click the link below to grab the bundle for yourself.
swipes.hookFramework: Stacked Irresistible Offer â†’ Social Proof Avalanche: Opens with superlative claim ("greatest free book offer of all time"), then stacks value layer by layer â€” free books + more free books + free Skool month â€” creating a "this can't be real" reaction. The $16 shipping creates a tripwire that qualifies buyers. 5M copies + 32K reviews provide overwhelming social proof.
swipes.copyStructure: Superlative hook â†’ Community prepaid story (altruism angle) â†’ Value stacking (books + books + Skool) â†’ Price anchor ($16) â†’ Bullet list of outcomes â†’ Social proof (5M copies, 32K reviews) â†’ Direct CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Aspiring and early-stage entrepreneurs who haven't yet committed to a high-ticket program but are willing to spend $16 to learn â€” top of funnel for the Skool ecosystem
swipes.whyItWorks: The "entrepreneurs prepaid for your copy" story creates goodwill and community belonging before the prospect even buys. Value stacking (3 books + Skool month) against $16 makes the offer feel absurdly generous. The bullet list (What to sell, How to sell it, How to scale it) maps perfectly to the 3 books while promising a complete business education. This is Hormozi's Skool funnel feeder â€” gets $16 buyers into the ecosystem.
swipes.notes: This is the Skool/book bundle funnel â€” feeds into Hormozi's broader community play. Multiple video lengths (0:44, 0:55). Also runs a static image variant with book display. The $16 tripwire likely has massive backend LTV through Skool upsells.

swipes.headline: Download Free Scaling Frameworks
swipes.primaryText: Business Owners â€“ real quick â€“ can I get your email? I want to send you the exact frameworks we've used to scale: â€¢ Sales â€¢ Teams â€¢ Communication â€¢ Compensation â€¢ Worker productivity These are the same systems we implement across our portfolio companies, and you can get themâ€”for free. But that's just the beginning. These frameworks are only a fraction of what we cover in our Scaling Workshop. Our two-day intensive at our headquarters includes: - Day 1: Deep dive into our proven scaling methodology - Day 2: Group sessions with our leadership team to help you apply it You'll leave with a clear, actionable plan to scale every function of your business. If you're serious about growth this year, spend two days in Vegas surrounded by high-level business owners who are in the trenches like you. ðŸ”— Download your free scaling frameworks â†’
swipes.hookFramework: Casual Permission Ask â†’ Framework Teaser â†’ Workshop Upsell: Opens with disarmingly casual "real quick â€“ can I get your email?" which breaks pattern from typical ad copy. Lists 5 specific framework topics as a teaser, then reveals they're just a fraction of the workshop content â€” creating a "if the free stuff is this good..." logical escalation.
swipes.copyStructure: Casual email ask â†’ 5-bullet framework list â†’ "Same systems" credibility claim â†’ Workshop reveal (Day 1/Day 2 breakdown) â†’ Peer pressure close ("high-level business owners") â†’ Dual CTA (download + book call)
swipes.targetAudience: Established business owners with teams who are struggling with specific operational scaling (sales processes, compensation structures, team communication) â€” more operational than aspirational
swipes.whyItWorks: The conversational opening ("real quick") breaks through ad fatigue by mimicking DM language. The 5-framework bullet list is specific enough to feel valuable but vague enough to require the download. The Day 1/Day 2 workshop breakdown builds tangibility for an event offer. The P.S. qualifying statement ("only for business owners with customers, revenue, and employees") creates exclusivity and filters tire-kickers. Runs as both carousel and single-creative variants.
swipeElements: dual funnel (free download â†’ workshop upsell)
carousel format with multiple CTA cards
swipes.notes: Hybrid lead gen + event ad. The frameworks lead magnet feeds email list while the workshop pitch captures high-intent prospects. Multiple carousel configurations (2-3 cards) with Leila Hormozi's name on some variants.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: Here's a hard truth: investors don't buy businesses that can't survive without the founder. It doesn't matter how much revenue you do. If every decision, every client, and every fire comes back to you, the value of your company is close to zero. That's key man risk. And until you solve it, you don't have an asset. You have a liability. We've built systems inside our portfolio companies to remove founder dependency and create businesses that actually scaleâ€¦ and sell. That's what we teach, hands-on, at our Scaling Workshop in Vegas. If you want to build something that outlives you, click below and let's talk.
swipes.hookFramework: Hard Truth â†’ Technical Term Education â†’ Identity Reframe: Opens with "hard truth" pattern interrupt, then introduces "key man risk" â€” a sophisticated investor term that makes the reader feel they've been blind to a critical business flaw. Reframes their business from "asset" to "liability" in one sentence. Portfolio company credibility backs the solution.
swipes.copyStructure: Hard truth hook â†’ Revenue irrelevance claim â†’ Key man risk definition â†’ Asset vs liability reframe â†’ Portfolio company proof â†’ Workshop CTA â†’ Legacy-driven close ("outlives you")
swipes.targetAudience: Founder-operators doing $3M-$50M who are considering eventual exit or investment, still deeply embedded in daily operations, and starting to feel the weight of being the bottleneck
swipes.whyItWorks: The "key man risk" concept is genuinely valuable education â€” most founders haven't heard this term but instantly recognize the problem. The asset/liability reframe is emotionally jarring ("your business is worth zero"). Multiple video lengths (0:24, 1:24, 0:35) suggest aggressive testing. The "outlives you" close taps into legacy/mortality motivation, which is powerful for 40-55 demographic.
swipeElements: revenue irrelevance shock ("doesn't matter how much you do")
swipes.notes: Workshop funnel ad targeting exit-minded founders. The "key man risk" angle is one of Hormozi's strongest â€” runs across 3+ video variants. Verified badge on some link preview variants adds trust.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: If your business can't run without you, you don't own a business. You own a job with overhead. You can't step away. You can't sell. You can't scale. The moment you stop working, the whole thing grinds to a halt. That's called key man risk, and it's the single biggest reason most businesses never make it past the founder. At our Scaling Workshop in Vegas, we help entrepreneurs learn the strategies that take them from "founder-dependent jobs" into real businesses. Systems. Teams. Processes. The things that free you from being the bottleneck. Click the link, book a call, and let's make your business work without you.
swipes.hookFramework: Identity Attack â†’ Capability Stripping â†’ Reframe Solution: Opens with devastating identity reframe ("you don't own a business, you own a job with overhead"). Then strips away perceived capabilities in rapid succession ("can't step away, can't sell, can't scale"). The "job with overhead" phrase is engineered to sting â€” it's worse than just having a job.
swipes.copyStructure: Identity attack hook â†’ Triple capability denial â†’ Key man risk label â†’ Workshop bridge â†’ Three-word solution list (Systems. Teams. Processes.) â†’ Action CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Overworked founder-operators who feel trapped in their business, can't take vacations, and are starting to resent what they built â€” typically $1M-$10M businesses
swipes.whyItWorks: The "job with overhead" line is one of the most effective reframes in business coaching ads â€” it's quotable, shareable, and cuts deep. The staccato "Systems. Teams. Processes." creates clarity and simplicity in the solution. Running since Nov 2025 with strong placement suggests this is a proven winner. The phrase "make your business work without you" is the ultimate dream state for burned-out founders.
swipes.notes: Variant of the key man risk angle but with punchier, more aggressive opening. "Job with overhead" is Hormozi's signature line. This version runs alongside ah-005 as an A/B test of the same concept with different emotional intensity.

swipes.headline: Learn How to Scale Your Business
swipes.primaryText: Most entrepreneurs don't realize they're the bottleneck. Every hire routes through them. Every fire lands on their desk. Every growth ceiling is tied to their bandwidth. That's why vacations feel impossible, and scaling feels like quicksand. At our Scaling Workshop, we map the exact stage your business is in and show you how to build the systems, leadership, and infrastructure that remove founder bottlenecks. Because the real risk isn't failureâ€¦ it's success that depends entirely on you. Click the link, book a call, and let's get you out of your own way.
swipes.hookFramework: Blind Spot Reveal â†’ Symptom Stacking â†’ Paradox Close: Opens by telling the reader they have a problem they don't even see ("don't realize they're the bottleneck"). Stacks specific symptoms (hires, fires, growth ceiling) that create "that's me" recognition. Closes with a paradox ("the real risk isn't failure, it's success") that reframes their achievement as their prison.
swipes.copyStructure: Blind spot hook â†’ Triple symptom stack (Every...Every...Every) â†’ Emotional resonance (vacations, quicksand) â†’ Stage-mapping promise â†’ Paradox close â†’ Action CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Successful but overwhelmed founders who intellectually know they need to delegate but emotionally can't let go â€” typically in the $2M-$15M range where team issues become critical
swipes.whyItWorks: The "Every...Every...Every" anaphora creates rhythm and recognition â€” readers nod along with each line. "Scaling feels like quicksand" is a visceral metaphor that captures the frustration of working harder but sinking deeper. The success-as-risk paradox is intellectually stimulating and shareable. Newest ad in the set (Feb 2026) suggests Hormozi is still actively testing workshop angles.
swipeElements: self-removal promise ("get you out of your own way")
swipes.notes: The softest of the three workshop copy variants. Less aggressive than "job with overhead" (ah-006), less technical than "key man risk" (ah-005). Targets the emotionally overwhelmed segment vs the exit-minded segment.

swipes.headline: It's not an event, it's a Scaling Workshop.
swipes.primaryText: If you run a home service business doing over $1M a year like HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, or cleaning, and the whole thing still runs through you, you don't own a business. You own a job with overhead. Every hire depends on you. Every problem finds you. Every client needs your approval. That's why you can't take time off. Why every growth spurt feels worse than standing still. That's called key man risk, and it's the reason most 7-figure businesses stay stuck forever. At my Scaling Workshop in Vegas, I show founders how to break out by building the systems, leadership, and processes that make the business run without them. If you're ready to stop being the bottleneck, click the link and book a call.
swipes.hookFramework: Vertical Qualification â†’ Shared Pain â†’ Same Solution: Opens by calling out a specific vertical (home services + $1M threshold) which massively increases relevance for that audience. Then applies the same "job with overhead" framework but with industry-specific context (HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, cleaning). The dedicated landing page (/workshop-hs) suggests a customized funnel for this vertical.
swipes.copyStructure: Vertical + revenue qualifier â†’ Industry examples â†’ "Job with overhead" hook â†’ Triple symptom stack â†’ Key man risk label â†’ Workshop solution â†’ Action CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Home service business owners (HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, cleaning) doing $1M+/year who are still the operational bottleneck â€” a specific, high-value segment Hormozi is carving out
swipes.whyItWorks: Vertical-specific ads dramatically outperform generic ads because the reader immediately thinks "this is for me." Naming HVAC, plumbing, landscaping, and cleaning creates concrete identification. The $1M qualifier filters for serious operators. The separate landing page (/workshop-hs vs /workshop-km) means Hormozi has built a complete vertical funnel â€” suggesting home services is a major target segment for Acquisition.com. "Multiple versions" tag indicates active creative testing.
swipeElements: headline reframe ("not an event, a workshop")
swipes.notes: Only vertical-specific ad in Hormozi's library. The separate /workshop-hs landing page and "multiple versions" testing suggest this vertical is performing well enough to warrant dedicated creative investment. Smart play â€” home services $1M+ owners are underserved by most business coaching.

swipes.headline: Turn Your Passion into a Business!
swipes.primaryText: Turn Your Passion into a Business! Love painting, gaming or fitness? Always giving advice or sharing ideas? Create a skool and monetize your passion! No tech stress. No pressure. Just share, teach & earn. Try it free for 14 days!
swipes.hookFramework: Passion Identification â†’ Frictionless Solution â†’ Risk-Free Trial: Opens by naming common passions (painting, gaming, fitness) to trigger self-identification. Positions Skool as the zero-stress monetization path. "No tech stress. No pressure" removes the two biggest objections for non-technical creators.
swipes.copyStructure: Passion hook â†’ Hobby examples â†’ Simple value prop â†’ Objection removal (no tech/no pressure) â†’ 14-day trial CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Hobbyists and passion-driven creators who share knowledge informally but haven't monetized â€” painters, gamers, fitness enthusiasts, advice-givers
swipes.whyItWorks: Ultra-short copy (3 sentences) optimized for scroll-stopping. The passion examples (painting, gaming, fitness) cast a wide net while feeling specific. "Just share, teach & earn" distills the entire business model into 5 words. Running with 2 ad variants since Oct 2025 suggests strong performance. This is Skool's broadest top-of-funnel play â€” targeting people who don't even think of themselves as entrepreneurs yet.
swipes.notes: Skool's simplest ad â€” targets the widest possible audience of hobbyists and passion-holders. The "you should make a skool for that" is becoming their signature tagline.

swipes.headline: Get started for FREE
swipes.primaryText: ðŸ‘‰ Join 171.9k community builders collectively earning over $1 billion per year on the Skool platform TODAY. â¤ï¸â€ðŸ”¥ Our mission: Bring community to over 1 billion people ðŸ¤ Simple setup: Launch your community and start receiving payments in under 90 seconds ðŸ’™ Proven funnel: Top creators grow by adding their link in social media bios, under YouTube videos, through our internal discovery feature, or with ads. Start your 14-day free trial now. What you get: âœ… Community software (community, classroom, calendar, map) âœ… Access to Skoolers community âœ… Training: Skool 101, Alex Hormozi's $100M Money Models. After trial: $9/mo Hobby or $99/mo Premium.
swipes.hookFramework: Massive Social Proof â†’ Mission Statement â†’ Speed Promise â†’ Value Stack: Opens with staggering numbers (171.9K builders, $1B/year) to create instant credibility. The mission statement ("1 billion people") adds purpose. "90 seconds" setup time demolishes the complexity objection. Hormozi name-drop adds celebrity credibility to the training.
swipes.copyStructure: Social proof numbers â†’ Mission â†’ Setup speed â†’ Growth channels â†’ Trial CTA â†’ Feature checklist â†’ Pricing transparency
swipes.targetAudience: Existing content creators with audiences (YouTubers, social media creators) who want to monetize through community but haven't found the right platform
swipes.whyItWorks: The $1 billion collective earnings number is the ultimate social proof â€” it's not one person's success, it's a platform-wide stat that suggests "everyone is winning here." The 90-second setup claim is specific enough to be believable and removes the "it's complicated" objection. Naming specific growth channels (bio links, YouTube, discovery, ads) gives a roadmap. Hormozi's training inclusion adds massive perceived value. 4+ ad variants running since Oct 2025.
swipes.notes: Skool's longest-form ad targeting serious creators. The transparent pricing ($9/$99) is notable â€” most SaaS ads hide pricing. This builds trust and pre-qualifies buyers. Runs with 4+ variants including video.

swipes.primaryText: Got a YouTube channel or following? You should make a skool for that ðŸ”¥ðŸ’¸ ðŸ“¹ AI or gaming content? ðŸŽ¨ Art tutorials? ðŸ’ª Fitness tips? ðŸ’¡ Always teaching or sharing knowledge? ðŸ‘‰ Whatever you create... skool offers the all-in-one no-headache tech to turn your audience into recurring customers. You build a community. Your subscribers and followers join. You teach, connect, and grow... all in one place ðŸŒ± ðŸ‘‰ No algorithm stress. No view pressure. Just real connection. Try it free for 14 days.
swipes.hookFramework: Existing Audience Qualification â†’ Anti-Algorithm Promise â†’ Recurring Revenue Reframe: Opens by qualifying YouTubers/creators ("Got a following?"), then names specific content niches. The key insight: positions Skool as escape from algorithm dependency. "No algorithm stress. No view pressure. Just real connection" directly addresses creator burnout.
swipes.copyStructure: Creator qualification â†’ Niche examples (AI, gaming, art, fitness) â†’ Platform value prop â†’ Community building steps â†’ Anti-algorithm positioning â†’ Trial CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Content creators with existing YouTube channels or social followings who are frustrated with algorithm dependence and want to build recurring revenue through community
swipes.whyItWorks: The anti-algorithm angle is brilliant for creator audiences â€” it addresses the #1 frustration of every YouTuber and social media creator. "Recurring customers" reframes followers as revenue (powerful for creators used to one-time views). The niche callouts (AI, gaming, art, fitness) are deliberately broad but feel specific. 5 variants running with video (0:24) suggests heavy testing. Running since Nov 2025.
swipes.notes: Creator-focused variant of Skool's main ad. The anti-algorithm angle differentiates from sk-001's passion approach â€” this targets established creators who already have audiences but want independence from platform algorithms.

swipes.primaryText: Please help us celebrate! Every quarter, Skool celebrates the community owners who grew the most in monthly recurring revenue ðŸ†ðŸ”¥ We celebrate the top 5 across our categories: ðŸŽ¨ Hobbies ðŸŽ¸ Music ðŸ’° Money ðŸ™ Spirituality ðŸ’» Tech ðŸ¥• Health âš½ Sports ðŸ“š Self-improvement â¤ï¸ Relationships The winner with the highest growth added +$311,641 in monthly recurring revenue, which of course is atypical, but we love to show the outstanding community owners of Skool and what they achieve ðŸŽ‰
swipes.hookFramework: Community Celebration â†’ Category Breadth â†’ Aspirational Outlier: Opens with "help us celebrate" which creates goodwill instead of selling. The 9 categories show breadth (hobbies to spirituality). The $311K MRR number is the aspirational anchor â€” the "atypical" disclaimer actually adds credibility by acknowledging it's an outlier.
swipes.copyStructure: Celebration hook â†’ Quarterly awards context â†’ 9 category list â†’ Winner's revenue number â†’ Honest disclaimer â†’ Trial CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Aspiring community builders across diverse niches who are motivated by seeing others' success â€” particularly those in non-business categories (hobbies, music, spirituality)
swipes.whyItWorks: The celebration framing turns an ad into a feel-good community moment. The 9 categories (with emoji) show that Skool isn't just for business coaches â€” it's for musicians, artists, spiritual teachers, etc. The $311K number is jaw-dropping but the "atypical" disclaimer prevents it from feeling like a scam. Multiple variants with different winner amounts ($311K vs $116K) suggest seasonal updates. This is essentially the Skool Games concept turned into an ad.
swipeElements: aspirational revenue number with honest disclaimer
swipes.notes: Skool Games turned into paid advertising. Directly relevant to LFG since Dan won 3x. The varied winner amounts ($311K in one version, $116K in another) suggest these are updated quarterly with fresh data. 5 variants running.

swipes.primaryText: Building your future online with a community is a brilliant idea, and there's no better place to do it than Skool ðŸ™Œ ðŸ‘‰ We're an all-in-one platform that lets you set up your community in minutes ðŸ˜ Start with our 14-day FREE trial. Then dive into the Skoolers community, where over 50,000 creators are collaborating and sharing what's working for them. People with monthly recurring revenue as high as $300K share openly what they're doing ðŸ¤¯ PLUS: You also get full beginner training in the community classroom ðŸ¤“ ðŸ‘‰ If you're serious about this, there's no better way to begin than by joining a community.
swipes.hookFramework: Validation â†’ Community Access â†’ Transparent Success Stories: Opens by validating the reader's idea ("brilliant idea") before introducing the platform. The 50K creators sharing openly creates a "rising tide" community feel. The $300K MRR example with "sharing openly" suggests you'll learn their secrets.
swipes.copyStructure: Idea validation â†’ Platform intro â†’ Trial offer â†’ Community access (50K creators) â†’ Revenue examples â†’ Training included â†’ Serious qualifier CTA
swipes.targetAudience: People who've been thinking about starting an online community but haven't committed â€” need encouragement and a clear starting path
swipes.whyItWorks: The opening validation ("brilliant idea") creates instant rapport â€” it's saying "you're right to be thinking about this." The 50K creators sharing openly is the real value prop â€” you're not just getting software, you're getting access to a mastermind. The $300K MRR data point creates aspiration. "If you're serious about this" at the end qualifies the reader and creates urgency. $1B collective earnings as a closing stat is massive social proof.
swipes.notes: The "encouragement" ad â€” targets people in the consideration phase. More emotional and supportive than the data-heavy sk-002. Video creative (0:39). 5 variants running.

swipes.primaryText: Plot twist: Many course creators making real money aren't selling courses anymore ðŸ¤¯ They're building communities on skool â¤ï¸â€ðŸ”¥ There are 50,000 skool community creators. Together, they're earning over $1 billion a year ðŸ’¸ Selling once is nice... but building something ongoing changes everything ðŸ’ª ðŸ‘‰ Build a group. Create consistency. Make it grow. Try Skool free for 14 days âœ¨
swipes.hookFramework: Industry Plot Twist â†’ Recurring vs One-Time Reframe â†’ Momentum CTA: Opens with "Plot twist" â€” a pattern interrupt that promises surprising information. Then reframes the course industry: the winners aren't selling courses, they're building communities. "Selling once vs ongoing" is the key insight that makes recurring revenue click.
swipes.copyStructure: Plot twist hook â†’ Course vs community reframe â†’ Social proof (50K, $1B) â†’ One-time vs recurring comparison â†’ Three-step simplification â†’ Trial CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Existing course creators who are tired of launch cycles and want recurring revenue â€” the "course fatigue" audience
swipes.whyItWorks: Directly targets course creators' pain point: the exhausting launch-sell-launch cycle. "Selling once is nice... but building something ongoing changes everything" crystallizes the recurring revenue advantage in one sentence. The ultra-short video (0:14) is optimized for Reels/Stories placements. The three-step CTA ("Build. Create. Grow.") makes it feel simple. Running since Sep 2025 â€” one of Skool's longest-running ads.
swipes.notes: Most strategically interesting Skool ad â€” directly attacks the course industry model. The 14-second video length is unusually short, suggesting this runs primarily in Stories/Reels placements. 5 variants since Sep 2025 makes this likely their best performer.

swipes.headline: NEW FREE 27-Hour Course: How I Made $4,000,000 Online
swipes.primaryText: I've just launched a FREE 27-hour course where I show how I made over $4,000,000 online in the past 2 years using a simple system. Inside, you'll learn: ðŸ”Ž How to pick a profitable niche ðŸ§© How to build a simple, clear offer ðŸŒ How to set up your website and funnel ðŸ“ˆ How to get clients with simple content ðŸš€ How to grow a one-person online business Start today while the course is still 100% free.
swipes.hookFramework: Absurd Free Value â†’ Revenue Proof â†’ Curriculum List â†’ Scarcity Close: Opens with "FREE 27-hour course" â€” the sheer length creates perceived value (most free courses are 1-2 hours). The $4M revenue proof in 2 years adds credibility. The 5-step curriculum is specific enough to feel actionable. "While the course is still 100% free" creates urgency without a deadline.
swipes.copyStructure: Free course announcement â†’ Revenue proof ($4M/2yrs) â†’ 5-emoji curriculum list â†’ Urgency/scarcity CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Aspiring online entrepreneurs who want to build a one-person business but don't know where to start â€” completely top-of-funnel, pre-revenue audience
swipes.whyItWorks: The 27-hour claim (also tested as 12-hour variant) is attention-grabbing because it signals massive depth. Hosting on Skool means the free course becomes the lead magnet that pulls people into Perzon's paid community. The emoji-bullets make the curriculum scannable. Running 20+ variants simultaneously (video lengths from 1:05 to 1:19) with both US and EU targeting. All launched Feb 2, 2026 â€” massive simultaneous ad blitz.
swipes.notes: Perzon's primary top-of-funnel ad. The 27-hour vs 12-hour variant test is interesting â€” testing whether bigger number = more conversions. All 71 ads launched Feb 2, 2026 suggests a major campaign launch. Feeds into skool.com/free-course community.

swipes.headline: How To Make ðŸ’° With Online Courses Using Skool, YouTube, Ads & AI
swipes.primaryText: How To Make ðŸ’° With Online Courses Using Skool, YouTube, Ads & AI. Learn the predictable traffic, lead & sales system I used to make $4M in 2 years. Interested? Let's Talk. Get a clear growth roadmap and a 90-day plan for your online course. On this call, we'll do 3 things: 1. Map out your full growth roadmap 2. Find your biggest growth opportunities 3. Build a clear 90-day plan. If you want a clear plan instead of guessing, book your free call now.
swipes.hookFramework: System Promise â†’ 3-Step Call Structure â†’ Value-First Guarantee: Opens with the "predictable system" promise, then structures the sales call as a value-giving session (roadmap + opportunities + 90-day plan). The "Even if you don't work with us, you'll leave with clarity" line removes risk and makes the call feel generous rather than salesy.
swipes.copyStructure: System headline â†’ Revenue proof â†’ Casual CTA ("Let's Talk") â†’ 3-step call breakdown â†’ No-risk guarantee â†’ Action CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Existing online course creators or coaches doing $5K-$50K/month who want a systematic approach to scaling â€” mid-funnel, already selling but want more
swipes.whyItWorks: The 3-step call structure is brilliant sales psychology â€” it frames the discovery call as a consulting session, not a pitch. "Even if you don't work with us" defuses objections before they form. Video lengths range from 0:34 to 12:24 minutes, suggesting aggressive testing of short vs long-form VSL-style ads. kourse.com is the paid offer domain (separate from the free Skool community).
swipes.notes: High-ticket funnel ad pointing to kourse.com/start (not Skool). The Kourse Masterclass is Perzon's paid offer. The extreme range of video lengths (30 seconds to 12+ minutes) suggests testing both short attention-grab and long-form VSL approaches within the same campaign.

swipes.headline: FREE Course: Scale Your Course Creator Business
swipes.primaryText: ðŸ“š COURSE CREATORS ðŸ“š If you already sell an online course on Skool, Kajabi, Teachable, or Thinkific and you're stuck at $5â€“$50k/mo, I have a 100% free course that shows you how I scaled past $100K/month. Inside: ðŸ’° How I made $4M in 2 years âš¡ How to stop selling time and build a scalable offer ðŸ“ˆ How to grow fast using YouTube + Meta Andromeda ads ðŸ¤– How to use AI to generate leads with predictability ðŸš€ How I hit 6+ figures/month. Tap [LEARN MORE] to get the free course NOW.
swipes.hookFramework: Vertical Callout â†’ Platform Recognition â†’ Revenue Ceiling Reframe: Opens with bold vertical identifier ("COURSE CREATORS") as a scroll-stopping pattern interrupt. Names specific platforms (Skool, Kajabi, Teachable, Thinkific) to create instant recognition. The $5-50K stuck point targets the exact audience who's proven but plateaued.
swipes.copyStructure: Vertical callout â†’ Platform name-check â†’ Revenue ceiling ($5-50K stuck) â†’ Free course offer â†’ 5-emoji curriculum â†’ YouTube + Meta Andromeda + AI specifics â†’ Action CTA
swipes.targetAudience: Course creators already doing $5K-$50K/month on platforms like Kajabi, Teachable, Thinkific, or Skool who feel stuck at their current revenue level
swipes.whyItWorks: The vertical-specific variants are Perzon's newest ads (Feb 20, 2026). He's running separate copies for: Course Creators, SMMA/Agency Owners, and Fitness/Health Coaches â€” each naming specific platforms and pain points for that vertical. "Meta Andromeda ads" is a specific/technical term that signals insider knowledge. The $5-50K qualifier pre-selects serious operators.
swipes.notes: Newest ads in Perzon's library (Feb 20). Also running SMMA/Agency variant ("drowning in service delivery") and Fitness/Health Coach variant ("tired of 1-1 coaching"). Same system, different hooks per vertical. This is the same playbook Hormozi uses with his home services ads.

swipes.headline: 27-Hour FREE Skool Course
swipes.primaryText: New 27-Hour Free Skool Course. Join today, it will be fun :)
swipes.hookFramework: Minimalist Casual â†’ Video Does The Selling: The copy is deliberately stripped to near-nothing ("Join today, it will be fun :)"). This is a pure video-first ad where the creative carries 100% of the persuasion load. The smiley face adds warmth and removes any perceived pressure.
swipes.copyStructure: One-line announcement â†’ Casual invitation â†’ Video carries the message
swipes.targetAudience: Same broad audience as mp-001 but optimized for video-first consumption â€” people who watch before reading
swipes.whyItWorks: A/B test against the long-copy mp-001. Tests whether letting the video do all the selling (with minimal copy friction) converts better than the detailed curriculum list. The casual tone ("it will be fun :)") is disarming in a sea of hype-heavy course ads. Running same video (1:05) as mp-001 with stripped copy.
swipes.notes: The anti-copy test. Interesting strategic choice â€” minimal text means the ad relies entirely on the video creative and thumbnail to stop the scroll. If this is still running alongside the long-copy variants, both approaches are working.
